applyAddChain((uint64,bytes[],bytes,(boo.details: Bulk function that allows multiple updates at once

applyAdminTransfer(address).details: Transfers admin on the TokenPool and ownership on the ZCHF token on the TokenAdminRegistry

params.newAdmin: The address of the new admin

params.chain: The chain to set the rate limits for
params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

deny(bytes32,address[]).details: Only qualified voters can deny proposals

params.hash: The hash of the proposal to deny
params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

proposeAddChain((uint64,bytes[],bytes,(b.details: The contract only stores the hash. So the data has to be passed in during apply again

params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

proposeAdminTransfer(address,address[]).details: Useful to transfer to a new CCIPAdmin contract

params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check
params.newAdmin: The address of the new admin

proposeRemotePoolUpdate((bool,uint64,byt.details: The contract only stores the hash. So the data has to be passed in during apply again

params.helpers: The helpers to get enough votes

proposeRemoveChain(uint64,address[]).details: The contract only stores the hash. So the data has to be passed in during apply again

params.helpers: Array of helper addresses for qualification check

registerToken(address).details: Can only be called while the token admin is not set

params.registry: The registry to register the token with

setTokenPool(address,(uint64,bytes[],byt.details: The token pool can only be set once

params.chainsToAdd: The chains to add to the token pool

acceptAdmin().notice: Accepts the admin role transfer on the TokenAdminRegistry

acceptOwnership().notice: Accepts ownership transfer on the TokenPool

applyRateLimit(uint64,(bool,uint128,uint.notice: Sets the rate limits for the given chain. Any qualified voter can apply rate limits with immediate effect. Rate limits can only do limited harm, so it is acceptable to be very permissive. At the same time, rate limits are typically applied during emergencies, e.g. when a chain has been hacked. Therefore, it is desirable to ensure that they can be applied quickly. Nonetheless, the proposal fee is still charged to discourage shenenigans.

applyRemotePoolUpdate((bool,uint64,bytes.notice: Applies the update on the TokenPool

deny(bytes32,address[]).notice: Denies and removes a pending proposal

proposeAddChain((uint64,bytes[],bytes,(b.notice: Propose to add or remove remote chains

proposeAdminTransfer(address,address[]).notice: Proposed a new admin for the TokenPool and Admin on the Token registry

proposeRemoveChain(uint64,address[]).notice: Propose to add or remove remote chains

registerToken(address).notice: Registers the token in the CCIP system

setTokenPool(address,(uint64,bytes[],byt.notice: Sets the token pool to administer, sets in in the TokenAdminRegistry, accept ownership, and applies the chain updates

userdoc.notice: The admin for briding Frankencoins using CCIP. Each chain needs an instance of this administrator.
